title: Resistive forces - dropping a foam ball

content.question: The acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for a foam ball released from rest near the surface of Earth is shown in the graph. The ball experiences a resistive force from the air. The magnitudes of the resistive force at times <math alttext="t sub 1 equals 0.1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 equals 0.8 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> are <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="F sub 1 is greater than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 is greater than F sub 1, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 is greater than F sub 1, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 2 is greater than F sub 1, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
